alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 2:48AM MST until January 31 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER TRAVEL CONDITIONS ACROSS MOUNTAIN PASSES... .Snow has ended for most areas across the Inland Northwest however temperatures are dropping increasing the risk for slick, icy travel for the morning commute. Snow showers, possibly moderate to heavy at times will continue to impact Stevens and Lookout Pass throughout the day. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Osburn, Dobson Pass, Kellogg, St. Maries, Fernwood, Lookout Pass, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Expect winter travel across 4th of July Pass and Lookout Pass on Interstate 90.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
